job_title: In Home Caregiver in Klamath Falls, OR
pros: Paydays were on time. Provided uniform.
cons:
Always on call, no real schedule. I wanted ft work, willing to work any day or times. My only request was I want a regular scheduled week, no on call stuff. They said sure, then for over a month constantly on call. They’d have me scheduled for the week alright, but then call me every day , several times a day IN THE MIDDLE OF MY SHIFT, asking me to change my schedule. If I said no, leave it as is, they took all hours away for the week!!! Ya never know if what they’ve got you scheduled for the next day will still be the same next day. Sometimes I’d be scheduled for an early morn shift like 7-3, go to bed night b4, wake up bright n early, only to find my shift disappeared, sure enuff, phone goes off, “yes, we cancelled that shift, wanna take a noon to 2pm and a 2:30 to 5:30 instead?” Noooooo….
Never knew what they were gonna do.
You could not get to know the clients bc they moved us around so much. Obnoxious questionnaire at end of shift, *Did you notice any changes in your patient? 
Lol! How would I know? I just met them today. Unlikely I’ll ever see them again. That’s not caregiving. 
Awful place, horrible management.

review_title: Great Entry-Level Job in Mental Health/Healthcare
job_title: Residential Support Specialist in Columbia, MO
pros:
3 different shifts to choose from (7a-3p, 2p-10p, 10p-8a), so there's some flexibility in scheduling.
Lots of overtime available for employees wanting to make money.
Team of supervisors available for support, including 24/7 on-call support
Raises available (I've been raised 3 times in one year)
Great for students, some downtime to complete homework
Job provides and pays for all training, including CPR/First Aid, CPI, Food Handler Training, Level One Med Aide and Insulin Admin
Christmas bonus every year
cons:
No scheduled lunch break, but, you can eat whenever you want. Employees can also leave to go get food if there are more than one staff in the building.
Usually single-staffed in the apartment buildings, but supervisors are available via on-call 
At times we are understaffed; this job has a high turnover. But supervisors are there to pick up shifts if support is needed.
Must (usually) find coverage if submitting vacation days or other time off (due to short-staffing, normally this is not as much of an issue).
Schedule is not made very far in advance. Usually is released the last week of the current month. Schedules are usually the same every month though, since every employee has a weekend rotation. Changes are only made with the employee's permission.

pros: Love the people I work with
cons: Could be more helpful to employees

cons: Upper management is out of touch with what it takes to do the day-to-day jobs of working hands on with clients. They’re focus is implementing programs that look good on paper but take away from the real needs the clients need met.

review_title: Great job at times, but the terrible times seem to outweigh the good
pros: Wonderful coworkers, generally supportive supervisors, some of the clients are the best people I've ever met. Holiday bonuses are really nice and appreciated.
cons: The people at the highest end of the chain do not care about their employees mental well-being nearly enough. There should be more vacation days given to cope with the stress of the job. Instead, we are expected to give up vacation days when the weather is rough in the winter and we are unsafe driving clients to make up for "productivity". Too many clients on caseloads, not enough space to work. I would take adding on four more CSS's and getting an office to work in over the holiday bonuses.

pros: great house manager, great team of staff, great internal education
cons: only one worker on overnight shifts with no duress alarm... houses I've seen have double high ceilings which turn into huge echo chambers with loud clients... they are anything but warm and "homely" ... more like a public library or business premises

job_title: Residential Support Specialist in Jefferson City, MO
pros: This was a very fulfilling job. Helping the clients and putting smiles on their faces was a great feeling. This is a perfect job for students. I worked here during my senior year of college.
cons: Terrible pay. The managers did a terrible job of managing. Watching the clients in terrible conditions at times. Huge bedbug problem.

job_title: Case Manager in Vero Beach, FL
pros: Supervisors and co-workers have excellent working relationships.  People are always willing to help one another out and assist with learning new procedures.
cons: Minimal pay for heavy caseloads.  Upper management does not allow over time and it is nearly impossible to complete required visits and documentation during scheduled work hours.

pros: Very aware of Human Resources protocol, however never employed in this department.  I quickly learn and have the desire to expand on my skills.
cons: I would not consider this as a con, but training is what I would expect for being productive.
